name: Air Fryer Chicken Katsu with Homemade Katsu Sauce
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: Air-fried chicken katsu that is crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. The sauce is a little bit sweet, a little bit tangy, and complements the chicken perfectly. Serve over rice if desired.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breast, sliced in half horizontally
1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Whisk ketchup, soy sauce, brown sugar, sherry, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic together in a bowl until sugar has dissolved
Preheat an air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Meanwhile, lay chicken pieces on a clean work surface
Place beaten eggs in a flat dish
Pour bread crumbs into a second flat dish
Dredge chicken pieces in egg and then in bread crumbs
Repeat by dredging chicken in egg and then bread crumbs again, pressing down so that the bread crumbs stick to the chicken
Place chicken pieces in the basket of the pre-heated air fryer
Spray the tops with nonstick cooking spray
Flip chicken pieces over using a spatula and spray the tops with nonstick cooking spray
Transfer chicken to a cutting board and slice
